<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our Back 2 School Week partnership with DonorsChoose.org ends tomorrow. <!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIG IDEAS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/29/wild-thoughts-elon-musk-jack-ma?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Elon: We're Doomed; Ma: We'll Be Fine...Maybe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Elon: We're Doomed; Ma: We'll Be Fine...Maybe" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY3MTA5MjcwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba = genius</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Folks, it's been a great run, but this will be the final Brew ever. After listening to Elon Musk and Alibaba's Jack Ma debate yesterday at the <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/billionaires-jack-ma-elon-musk-205429278.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">World AI Conference</a>, we're headed to a remote Pacific island to live out the rest of our days in a blissful stupor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they said:</strong> Humanity is doomed by an impending population collapse. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Okay, maybe we’re being dramatic. </strong>Elon thinks we're in a simulation and AI will destroy us. Ma thinks we're irreplaceable and AI will dramatically reduce our work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s dive in.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">On learning</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both Ma and Musk think tech will <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/business-leaders/alibaba-artificial-intelligence-work-week-jack-ma?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">transform education</a> as we know it.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ma: </strong></span><span>"For the next 10, 20 years, every human being, country, government should focus on reforming the education system, making sure our kids can find a job, a job that only requires three days a week, four hours a day." Keep in mind, Ma </span><span><a href="https://www.scmp.com/tech/policy/article/3005946/alibabas-jack-ma-defends-chinas-996-schedule-tech-workers-protest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">endorses</a></span><span> a grueling 996 work schedule (9am</span><span><span>–</span></span><span>9pm, six days a week). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Musk: </strong></span><span>"The way education works right now, it's really low bandwidth, it's extremely slow, lectures are the worst...Down the road with </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/07/18/internet-brains?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neuralink</a></span><span> you can just upload any subject instantly, it will be like the Matrix."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The future of work</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ma, the AI optimist, and Musk, the pessimist, <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-49508091?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revisited</a> their long-held beliefs:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ma: </strong></span><span>"I don't worry about jobs...Computers only have chips, men have the heart. It's the heart where the wisdom comes from."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Musk: </strong></span><span>"AI will make jobs kind of pointless...Probably the last job that will remain will be writing AI, and then eventually, the AI will just write its own software."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The one thing they agreed on…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...is what no one wants to hear. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Musk:</strong></span><span> "The biggest issue in 20 years will be </span><span><a href="https://qz.com/1697884/jack-ma-and-elon-musk-are-worried-about-a-population-collapse/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">population collapse</a></span><span>, not explosion collapse."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ma:</strong></span><span> "I absolutely agree with that."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We'll close off with some classic Elon zingers: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"We are already a cyborg."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"The first thing you should assume is that we are very dumb, and that we can definitely make things smarter than ourselves."</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/29/hurricane-dorian-expected-take-large-economic-bite?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who Needs Beaches When You Can Have Storm Shutters
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Who Needs Beaches When You Can Have Storm Shutters" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY3MTEyMTczLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>National Hurricane Center</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hurricane Dorian visited Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands Thursday, largely <a href="https://apnews.com/be155ca6f5b240bd97ac9adc03b58521?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sparing</a> them from serious damage. Now, it's drinking in the warm ocean water like a protein shake and has the potential to hit Florida as a Category 4. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means by the time it makes landfall Monday, Dorian could bring 130 mph winds. Analysts are <a href="https://www.reinsurancene.ws/hurricane-dorian-analysts-point-to-10bn-industry-loss-potential/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicting</a> anywhere from $10 billion to $30 billion in insurance losses. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Dorian really couldn't have picked a worse time </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You wore shorts to the office today, so you know better than anyone: Labor Day is one of the busiest weekends of the year for traveling. A record <a href="http://airlines.org/media/2019-labor-day-air-travel-forecast/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2.5 million daily travelers</a> are expected across U.S. airlines around the holiday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>American and Southwest are </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/29/hurricane-dorian-prompts-american-airlines-to-waives-change-fees-for-florida-flights.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">helping passengers</a></span><span> change their tickets. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Other airlines are </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/tropical-storm-dorian-airlines-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offering</a></span><span> vouchers and waivers to help travelers passing through Florida or the Caribbean. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while most things have gone right for Disney this year, this is not one of them. Dorian is set to slam Florida the opening weekend of Disney World’s new <em>Star Wars</em> attraction.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/29/epa-proposes-roll-back-methane-regulations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The EPA Goes Insane in the Methane
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjM3L29pbC0xNjg1OTgxXzk2MF83MjBfanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by isakarakus at Pixabay.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Environmental Protection Agency proposed <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/29/climate/epa-methane-greenhouse-gas.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolling back regulations</a> on methane emissions to make life easier for the oil and gas industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Specifically, the EPA wants to remove a rule requiring oil and gas companies to install tech that monitors and fixes methane leaks in their equipment. It's also wondering whether it can legally regulate methane in the first place. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The case for regulation: </strong>climate change. You've heard about the heat-trapping effects of CO2 in the atmosphere, but swap the oxygen atoms for four hydrogens and now we're really cooking. Methane, or CH4, is <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/2019/08/29/trump-administration-reverse-limits-methane-powerful-greenhouse-gas/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated</a> to have over 80x the heat-trapping effects of carbon dioxide, though it doesn't stay in the atmosphere as long. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's the industry's reaction?</strong> Depends who you ask, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-rollback-of-methane-regulations-splits-energy-industry-11567098375?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to the WSJ</a>. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The big guns </strong></span><span>(ExxonMobil, Shell, BP) think more methane emissions would hurt the case for natural gas as a source of cleaner fossil fuels.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Independent, small, and midsized producers</strong></span><span> feel they disproportionately suffer from the regulations, so they're happy to see the rules go. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You know what comes next</strong>...legal battles. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/29/senators-pressure-amazon-rid-site-unsafe-products?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bezos Is a Messy Shopkeeper
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bezos Is a Messy Shopkeeper" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY3MTE1NTY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One week ago, the WSJ published a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-has-ceded-control-of-its-site-the-result-thousands-of-banned-unsafe-or-mislabeled-products-11566564990?shareToken=stf528a8da601e4017bdfc2faa508e09a2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> documenting Amazon's (+1.26%) lax oversight on items listed by third-party sellers. Browsing the website, you could have stumbled across a product banned by federal regulators, or searched for toys that neglected warnings about health risks for children.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, three Democratic senators <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/29/senators-ask-jeff-bezos-to-crack-down-on-unsafe-products-on-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote a letter</a> to Jeff Bezos telling him to clean up his store. "Unquestionably, Amazon is falling short of its commitment to keeping safe those consumers who use its massive platform," they wrote. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Journal notes that since its report, Amazon has changed the wording on listings or removed most of the red flag items, but many are cropping back up. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Amazon doesn't just have the biggest stand at the digital farmers market...it <em>runs </em>the market. Last year, third-party merchants <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/why-amazon-needs-others-to-keep-selling-11555002984?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contributed</a> 58% of Amazon's gross merchandise sales, up from 30% a decade ago. Plus, third-party sales have much higher margins than when Amazon sells directly to you.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead</strong>...Connecticut Sen. Richard Blumenthal said he wants to hold congressional hearings once Bezos responds to the letter.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/29/brews-weekly-news-quiz-august-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Love It When You Call Me Quizorita
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Busier than a Chinese Costco. Lower than government bond yields. Ready for the long weekend. It's the Brew's Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Name the restaurant chain behind each plant-based meat substitute:</p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Impossible Whopper</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beyond Taco</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Impossible Slider</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beyond Sausage Breakfast Sandwich </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Martin Scorsese’s upcoming movie will be released in indie theaters before coming to Netflix less than a month later. What is the movie called? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank: </strong>32 companies in the ______ industry signed a sustainability pact at the G7. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Which country’s president announced he’s moving the capital to another island? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. On Sunday, Toyota revealed an electrified fleet of vehicles, including this autonomous e-Palette. What major event will it be used for? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/m-rlt4sg8T7zcmoMvqxMqnKXH7g5ItWqQ_XHyQmnDPu_Gf2-rPwfot7yckTX0KsWMP6124tzi_poBYfRDdpAZH0qACDw1241x4UW8i1U_u3m4bx5ge_EE5eu6ZaJiSctAAAKM6Fk" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text">Toyota</sup></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1. a) Burger King b) Del Taco c) White Castle d) Dunkin’ 2. The Irishman 3. Fashion 4. Indonesia 5. 2020 Olympics </em></sup></p>

Analysts are \u003ca href=\"https://www.reinsurancene.ws/hurricane-dorian-analysts-point-to-10bn-industry-loss-potential/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicting\u003c/a\u003e anywhere from $10 billion to $30 billion in insurance losses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDorian really couldn't have picked a worse time \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou wore shorts to the office today, so you know better than anyone: Labor Day is one of the busiest weekends of the year for traveling. #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolling back regulations\u003c/a\u003e on methane emissions to make life easier for the oil and gas industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpecifically, the EPA wants to remove a rule requiring oil and gas companies to install tech that monitors and fixes methane leaks in their equipment. It's also wondering whether it can legally regulate methane in the first place. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case for regulation: \u003c/strong\u003eclimate change. You've heard about the heat-trapping effects of CO2 in the atmosphere, but swap the oxygen atoms for four hydrogens and now we're really cooking. Methane, or CH4, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/2019/08/29/trump-administration-reverse-limits-methane-powerful-greenhouse-gas/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated\u003c/a\u003e to have over 80x the heat-trapping effects of carbon dioxide, though it doesn't stay in the atmosphere as long. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's the industry's reaction?\u003c/strong\u003e Depends who you ask, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-rollback-of-methane-regulations-splits-energy-industry-11567098375?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big guns \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e(ExxonMobil, Shell, BP) think more methane emissions would hurt the case for natural gas as a source of cleaner fossil fuels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIndependent, small, and midsized producers\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e feel they disproportionately suffer from the regulations, so they're happy to see the rules go. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYou know what Browsing the website, you could have stumbled across a product banned by federal regulators, or searched for toys that neglected warnings about health risks for children.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, three Democratic senators \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/29/senators-ask-jeff-bezos-to-crack-down-on-unsafe-products-on-amazon.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote a letter\u003c/a\u003e to Jeff Bezos telling him to clean up his store. \"Unquestionably, Amazon is falling short of its commitment to keeping safe those consumers who use its massive platform,\" they wrote. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Journal notes that since its report, Amazon has changed the wording on listings or removed most of the red flag items, but many are cropping back up. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon doesn't just have the biggest stand at the digital farmers market...it \u003cem\u003eruns \u003c/em\u003ethe market. Last year, third-party merchants \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/why-amazon-needs-others-to-keep-selling-11555002984?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtributed\u003c/a\u003e 58% of Amazon's gross merchandise sales, up from 30% a decade ago. Plus, third-party sales have much higher margins than when Amazon sells directly to you.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/strong\u003e...Connecticut Sen. Richard Blumenthal said he wants to hold congressional hearings once Bezos responds to the letter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
